title: National security fears from Cobham takeover spur stronger protection for UK companies
text:
British firms working on national security projects are to get tougher protection against foreign takeovers following an outcry over the sale of defence company Cobham.

The Queen’s Speech revealed plans to give ministers stronger powers when they scrutinise sales and mergers which could endanger UK interests.

A spate of takeovers has raised concerns about foreign ownership, including the £4bn acquisition of FTSE 250 aerospace business Cobham by US private equity fund Advent.
